job_title: Contract Manager in Milton Keynes, England
pros: Great company, motivated, forward thinking and diverse
cons: There are no cons surround this.

job_title: Finance Business Partner in Milton Keynes, England
pros:
• Colleagues are very enthusiastic, friendly and work cohesively.
• Leadership and EMT are incredibly approachable and encourage creativity, all while reflecting the companies values. All are very friendly and provide a positive ‘tone at the top’ culture.
• Over the last few years GUHG have adopted a more flexible working approach, which reflects the current working climate and fits in well with working life
• The office (K2) in Kents Hill, MK is very modern, spacious and welcoming. It’s been laid out with employees in mind with plenty of different areas to support various working styles e.g. break out areas, meeting pods, open plan
• Customers are at the core of GUHGs values, which means you hear a lot of the great stories about the positive impact the work people do has on the customers lives. A great morale booster!
cons: Very few come to mind, however I can see that in some areas career progression may sometimes be difficult as opportunities to climb the ladder don’t come up very often.

review_title: An organisation that lives its values
job_title: Board Member in Milton Keynes, England
pros: Driven to more to help customers in the housing sector in our region.
cons: Sometimes risk averse and slow to change

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Milton Keynes, England
pros: Company have a great vision and senior management are down to earth and knowledgeable
cons: Some systems and processes can be quite old-fashion but they are working on improving this

pros: Modern office, benefits ok. Flexible working opportunities.
cons:
Lack of promotion for current employees
No desire to retain skills and knowledge of current employees, allowing great staff to leave. 
Static pay scale means no incentive to perform better than colleagues as even new starters in the same role will get same pay.

job_title: Communications Officer in Milton Keynes, England
pros: Genuinely cares about their people and customers, lots of oppertunities for development, leads the way in supporting a work life balance and takes mental health seriously, always striving to do better. Genuinely lovely place to work.
cons: People stay for a really long time so sometimes progression up the ladder can be slow for some.

pros: Decent offices but long commute between
